alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 5:28PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, northern Lake and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, DeLand, Leesburg, Eustis, Tavares, Lady Lake, Mount Dora, Orange City, Lake Helen, Pierson, Paisley, Cassia, DeLeon Springs, Barberville, DeBary, Lisbon, Emeralda and Lake Griffin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
